label: 在郷馬
本: The Making of a Japanese Periphery, 1750-1920 . University of California Press . 1995
説明文: The alternative favored by area merchants was private packhorse network. Pack trains from villages outside the official system, often called rural horses" (zaigō ma), originated with peasants carrying their own produce to market. Such independent operators were ubiquitous in Japan during the Edo period. [See 手馬]"
